meanings.definition: A common weed with yellow flowers.
meanings.sent1: The farmer pulled up the charlock from his garden.
meanings.sent2: The charlock grew wild in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit nibbled on the charlock, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The field was a sea of charlock, a bright yellow carpet under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of charlock filled the air, signaling the arrival of spring.

meanings.definition: To weed out or remove charlock from a field.
meanings.sent1: She charlocked the unwanted plants from the flower bed.
meanings.sent2: The farmer charlocks the invasive weeds to protect his crops.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully charlock the dandelions from the lawn.
meanings.sent4: With determination, he charlocked the pesky charlock from the field.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's hands were stained green from charlocking all day.

meanings.definition: The seeds of the charlock plant.
meanings.sent1: The birds feasted on the charlock seeds scattered on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The charlock seeds were carried by the wind to new places.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels stored the charlock seeds for the winter, mistaking them for nuts.
meanings.sent4: Each charlock seed held the promise of new life in the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The farmer saved the charlock seeds to plant in the following spring.
